body: I don't understand this issue. What do you mean by "make logs useful"?
I do not agree with code that inspects the environment. Itâ€™s fine, to a degree, for an application, but it has no place in a library.

I think we should move https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/dd059016134f97fa8b8509e373dbc0b8194455a4/fastify.js#L501-L504 to https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/dd059016134f97fa8b8509e373dbc0b8194455a4/fastify.js#L397.

I'll send a PR.
Any reason why we use `process.warning` rather `log.warn(msg, err.stack)` as in the other places like https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/dd059016134f97fa8b8509e373dbc0b8194455a4/fastify.js#L603?
@StarpTech I'd like your idea, would be great

issue.title: Emit warning synchronously

repository.name: fastify
repository.description: Fast and low overhead web framework, for Node.js

issue.body:
Fixes #1656

<!--
Thank you for your pull request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests and possibly benchmarks.

Tip: `npm run bench` to compare branches interactively.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Checklist

- [x] run `npm run test` and `npm run benchmark`
- [x] tests and/or benchmarks are included
- [x] commit message and code follows [Code of conduct](https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

body:
> Any reason why we use process.warning rather log.warn(msg, err.stack) as in the other places like

@StarpTech because this is a deprecation warning rather than a runtime warning.

> @StarpTech because this is a deprecation warning rather than a runtime warning.

Doesn't it depends on the context?

```js
  fastify.log.info(`server listening on ${address}`)
  fastify.req.info(`foo`)
```

I see no reason why a user has to maintain multiple sources. This issue is a good example for that.
I just followed the same pattern that Node.js follows for deprecations. It seems worthwhile to keep consistency.
Thanks everyone who helped me fix this bug :)
